review_text: Free parking underground. Spacious. Nice staff (taking time looking for a different Happy Meal toy for my son).
According to the internet there is gluten-free burgers but not at this MC Donald's

Amazing how different and then similar it was to U.S. Different: lots of healthy menu options, beautiful patio, bakery counter, recyclable silverware. Same: was still fast food with traditional menu items.

It's just a McDonald's, but I like the aesthetic and location. Food is good and the service is really fast. The staff is nice and friendly. Sometimes it's really crowded but it's because it's close to the university.
Beautiful fasfood place, service is so nice, personnel face wity smiley
A bit noisy place as you expect from a huge area with many people.  Nice staff, nice food and nice price. Recommended if you are looking for a family place and bring your teens and kids.

This place deserves all 5 stars. The food for two people is not only delicious but you get value for your money. Service is great, atmosphere more traditional. I recommend coming here if you want food at high standard üòã
Very good food...it does get loud and boisterous...great  for large family groups and gatherings...could use some more air conditioning..but the food is solid and well presented...
Popular restaurant.  Definitely make a reservation especially during the summer and weekends

Ossinhos is a great value for the money! Staff is, all in all very friendly, with a handful of them really standing out for their attention either the clients! I usually just go with chicken, ribs and leit√£o. Saturday‚Äôs feijoada √† brasileira dia, really good! Especially if you take it out as servings are really generous ;)

One of the nicest all you can eat sushi places in Aveiro. I went for my birthday and really had a great time. The servers speak English and you get your own tablet to order. The restaurant is very spacious and can Accomodations to large groups. It‚Äôs not the cheapest but from the other similar places I‚Äôve been to around town it definitely is one of the nicest! They even had sake! It wasn‚Äôt fresh but they serve it by the glass (which I‚Äôve never had before).

This is the most delicious and exquisite sushi we have ever eaten, top food, top service, top management, and the decoration is elegant and classy. You can tell that this is a well-trained team. It makes people feel very happy and comfortable. I already want to eat there again.

This is the best place I have ever been to. The concept is simple: you order your dishes from a tablet. And this is not just a gimmick! The food is very good, and some dishes are very special. The place is beautiful and has a retro vibe. You should go and see for yourself!
One of the best sushi restaurants in Portugal - I also loved their dessert - Tiramisu with Macha
great service, nice place with relaxing music, I was served well and quickly, the shrimp and salmon were very well served. gratitude for being in an environment that feels like home
Really good food, try the cod fish!
Good food, a bit expensive and very very noisy
Good food, nice staff.
Great food and great service.  This is worth a trip.  They have both seafood and meat dishes.  All great.
A local and friendly trattoria like restaurant. Very good portuguese food. Excelent quality-price relationship.
Good self-service experience, good ingredients, very nice staff. A bit expensive though.

Best A√ßa√≠ ever. All kinds of options and just delicious. The owner let me try all options and then I was able to chose myself what to pick. And the snacks they have are also so good. The owners are also very sweet and helpful. Next time in Aveiro I will return.

Best a√ßa√≠ I have ever tried. I never new there were so many different variations of a√ßa√≠ and the owner let us try all of them before we order ( Cupua√ßu flavour is delicious).
Great service and fair price.
I will definetly choose this place every time I have my a√ßa√≠ cravings üòÅü•∞
Amazing and cheerful staff! I loved the a√ßa√≠ even if it was my first try!
Excellent team! Original a√ßa√≠ from Brazil, with another options to the people. I strongly recommend!!!

Food poisoning alert!! We have ordered takeaway twice from this place within the last month. Both times, one of us have gotten food poisoning from the chicken wings. Very disappointing, and I advise people to stay away!

There weren't many people, only me, but the service was really bad somehow. Staff forgot the ice cream and reacted  as  I did something wrong, looked very blamy as I'm the problem and not the missing ice cream. The other time I ordered 1 type of chicken, but they gave me a different one in different amounts, it seems that they do that not occasionally. Note for everyone eating here: never be nice with the staff here as they consider it as a weakness and check what you ordered every time after your order is complete.
Pretty good food and the staff was kind and efficient.
Yum yum! Great service, great food.

This p≈Çace is so bad, time for a worker to come to the cashier takes ages, besides that the quality of the meal is very far from what you can find in other KFC restaurants. Small pieces that you can barely find in the bag that you get. Drinks? Just sweet water. Not worth it at all, complately unsatisfying. Many better option to chose.

Fantasticrestaurant!
Delicious food: I loved the ceviche and the leitao croquetas for starters. Arroz de mariscos and picanha for main and a great petit gateau for dessert.
The service is friendly and professional.
I also liked how it is well decorated (even though i am not a fan of plastic plants) and with modern interior
Prices are ok. Pricey compared to Portuguese standards but that's obvious to be expected considering the quality and the place

Returning to this restaurant for the second time, our expectations were once again exceeded. After over ten years of honest exploration in Portugal, I can confidently say that this restaurant stands out as one of the best I‚Äôve ever experienced.

The service was impeccable ‚Äì helpful, friendly, and authentic. Our request was honored, and we were seated with a view into the kitchen, which added an exciting dimension to our dining experience. The food was flawless, with the daily fish being particularly delicious, along with all the appetizers we sampled.

The wine recommendation was spot-on, perfectly aligning with my tastes as described to the waiter, who demonstrated not only expertise in food but also in wine ‚Äì a definite plus. The ambiance was charming, with the entire team, aside from the kitchen, exuding warmth. The restaurant‚Äôs decor was beautifully curated, adding to the overall experience.

I‚Äôm already looking forward to my next visit. This restaurant is my top recommendation for anyone visiting Portugal ‚Äì don‚Äôt miss out on it.

I went there with a friend to celebrate a professional achievement, and we chose this restaurant based on the reviews we found online. We went there with high expectations but the whole experience was really disappointing!!
Starting with charging the Couvert (bread, butter and p√¢t√©) per person, I really do not understand the logic here! What if a group of ten people goes there and only half of them ate the couvert, those who did not eat would still pay 2‚Ç¨ each for something that they didn‚Äôt even try?! As starters, we ordered the prawns (6 prawns) and tuna ceviche (both not included in the menu here). They both tasted nice but the ceviche was served as two mini tacos with literally un-chewable mini tortilla. We also got the vegetable soup that was average.
For main dishes we ordered ‚ÄúBraised octopus tentacle‚Äù and the ‚ÄúLow temperature oxtail‚Äù. The oxtail was acceptable,  a small cuboid with pur√©e and some vegetables. However, the octopus (served with sweet potato puree and a small pot of octopus pearl barley) was dry and flavorless with very very hard skin that I needed to spit out some bites for not being able to chew them, it definitely does not represent the world-famous Portuguese octopus.
After not being asked our opinion about the main dishes, our choice for dessert was the almond cake. While the cake itself (sponge cake with the ‚ÄúAveirense‚Äù egg cream ‚Äúovos moles‚Äù with some almond flakes on top) was covered with an overwhelming amount of powder sugar, it was served with nice cinnamon ice-cream.
At the end, all we wanted was finishing the meal with a nice cup of coffee, so I ordered an espresso and my friend ordered an ‚Äúabatanado‚Äù (an espresso with some more water) and a ‚ÄúGLASS‚Äù of water with coffee. We got coffee from a commercial brand that was almost double the price of specialty coffee at a coffee roaster caf√©, and instead of the glass of water I asked for, I got a 2.5‚Ç¨ 30cl bottle of water.
Maybe having high expectations is the reason behind this negative review but I genuinely find everything we ordered very overpriced for what it is.

I highly recommend this restaurant. Great food. Had the set menu - everything was great. The scallop with green apple caviar and beurre blanc sauce was incredible.

Server was friendly and gave good explanations of the dishes.

It was a bit away from the historic center of Aveiro but worth the walk or short Uber.

The portion sizes were pretty huge! We honestly could have shared one of the dishes + 2 soups and therefore been able to eat dessert. However, our waiter wasn‚Äôt very informative in that manner. Just wanting to push sales for the tasting menu (we both felt). And thus we were too full to eat dessert :( The food was so good we ordered home delivery again the next day (the polvo). I feel like a dining experience should be the whole package. And for me the service could have been better in terms of actually recommending and advising instead of trying to sell. The fish soup is amazing here!

Disappointing Experience at Domino's Pizza in Aveiro

I recently visited Domino's Pizza in Aveiro with a group of friends, excited to try the "all you can eat" menu that included unlimited drinks. Unfortunately, the experience fell short of our expectations, and I would like to share my negative review with you.

Upon arrival, we were informed that the "all you can eat" menu did not include unlimited drinks as we had anticipated. Instead, we were offered a menu without any drinks included, but at the same price. This discrepancy from the advertised offer left us disappointed, as we had specifically chosen the restaurant for the option of unlimited drinks.

Furthermore, we expressed our dissatisfaction to the staff and the misunderstanding that had occurred. We were disappointed that no discount or remedy was offered for the inconvenience. It would have been appreciated if a gesture of goodwill had been made to compensate for the discomfort caused.

Regarding the food, we were let down by the quality that didn't resemble a real pizza in the slightest. The pizzas lacked flavor, the texture of the crust was not authentic, and it seemed that the ingredients used were of low quality. We didn't expect to have an artisanal pizza, but the difference was so noticeable that it was difficult to truly enjoy the food.

In conclusion, my experience at Domino's Pizza in Aveiro was disappointing due to the lack of unlimited drinks as promised in the "all you can eat" menu, the absence of any remedy or discount offered for the inconvenience, and the quality of the food that bore no resemblance to a real pizza. I cannot fully recommend this restaurant to those seeking a satisfying pizza experience.

I hope that my review can be helpful to those looking for alternatives for a pizza evening in Aveiro.

Don't order their pizza on glovo, they have the worst delivery service and spoiler alert: your pizza will never arrive. When you try to call them to ask where your pizza is, they just hang up the call because they do not speak english apparently.
Make sure to get a table outside if you‚Äôre getting the  ‚ÄúCome e Bebe‚Äù Menu, otherwise if you step a toe nail out of the door while eating inside, the manager will stop getting you food.
Horrible delivery service. Guys just come at whatever time they please, then leave with the pizza. So you must walk for it to the shop like you didnt order delivery.
The employees are all very nice and helpful.
Overall good food, but it strays far from the authentic Mexican experience, which is expected since it's a fast food place.

Today I bought a burrito and a Pepsi here, I paid 4.45 euros. The burrito was empty. There was some sauce smeared on it and there were a couple of grains of meat, most of it was dry pita. This wasn't my first time here, and I've been served by other people before, the girls. They made mge a great juicy burrito that had a lot of toppings. I can't understand why the food was so bad today??? I love Mexican fast food, but I won't be coming here again.

very lovely service,beautiful atmosphere, but I had
Diarrhea after, my burrito was very taste but something went wrong.

It's in a shopping mall atmosphere...
Courteous service... Enjoy the texmax.
I have a very good experience everything is very fresh and the food is very tasty.

I ordered a Alabama burger menu with a beans soup, I thought let's try something different. Within 20 seconds my order was ready which worried me a little bit... It turned out I got the wrong soup (which didn't have any flavour at all) and the burger barely had sauce and was definitely not fresh. I got 6 bags of tomato ketchup though which is nice but I didn't have anything to put it on but proofs that they don't know what they are doing. Once again learned to not go to Macdonald's!
Excellent service! Best place in Aveiro!
Good option for a quick meal. Fast response to requests.
I ordered a fish burger. Awesome!
I didn't eat there, but that was a good looking McDonald's.
